features: Pre-installed apps like VS-Code, Firefox and Chromium
Mitigated most of the major errors.
More performant than normal Andronix distros.
info.name: Ubuntu XFCE
info.description: If you're looking for a stable distro with some reasonable customization options which is also the world's most popular distribution, look no further than Ubuntu.

info.name: Manjaro XFCE
features: Pre-installed apps like VS-Code, Firefox and Chromium
Mitigated most of the major errors.
More performant than normal Andronix distros.
info.description: Manjaro is a distribution based on Arch Linux but has a separate official repository which contains more stable packages than that of Arch Linux's. You can't go wrong with Pacman and Manjaro.

info.name: Debian XFCE
features: Pre-installed apps like VS-Code, Firefox and Chromium
Mitigated most of the major errors.
More performant than normal Andronix distros.
info.description: Debian Linux is considered one of the most stable Linux distributions out there. You can completely rely on Debian for the stability and performance that you might need for your day-to-day tasks.

info.name: Ubuntu KDE
features: Pre-installed apps like VS-Code, Firefox and Chromium
Mitigated most of the major errors.
More performant than normal Andronix distros.
info.description: Ubuntu again being one of the reliable distributions of there but the star of the show is the beautiful KDE desktop environment. From smooth animations to just a better UX overall, KDE has got you covered with everything.
